hypothesis_content.title: Failed Breakdown Momentum Reversal in Bear Regimes
hypothesis_content.statement: In BEAR or STRESS regimes, when BTC breaks below a key support level (previous 10-day low) but reclaims it within the same trading day, a short-term counter-trend momentum move of 4-8% will occur over the next 3-5 days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Failed breakdowns in bear markets often trap shorts and trigger covering rallies. The intraday volatility indicates panic selling exhaustion. This creates powerful but short-lived counter-trend momentum as positions are unwound.
entry_conditions: Regime classification is BEAR or STRESS
BTC trades below previous 10-day low during intraday
BTC closes above previous 10-day low (failed breakdown)

exit_conditions.take_profit: 6% price appreciation from entry OR 3 consecutive up days
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Close below the failed breakdown low

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Less than 45% of signals are profitable, OR average maximum adverse excursion exceeds 8% before reversal.
